content: H2TIA (11.7 mg, 0.05 mmol), Cu­(NO3)2·3H2O (24.2 mg, 0.1 mmol), 4,4′-PBY (7.8 mg, 0.05 mmol), and 5 mL of methanol were added in a 15 mL reactor in turn, and then the mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 days. After that, the autoclave was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 1.5 °C·h–1. Blue rectangular crystals of Cu-1 (10.16 mg) were obtained (yield 65% based on H2TIA). Elem anal. IR (KBr pellet): 3446 (b), 3389 (b), 3127 (s), 1708 (s), 1627 (m), 1427 (m), 1364 (s), 1207 (w), 1135 (s), 1076 (m), 983 (w), 845 (w), 664 (m), 539 (s) cm–1.
clean_text:
Preparation of {[Cu(TIA)]⋅1.5CH3OH} n  (Cu-1)

H2TIA (11.7 mg, 0.05 mmol), Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (24.2 mg, 0.1 mmol), 4,4'-PBY (7.8 mg, 0.05 mmol), and 5 mL of methanol were added in a 15 mL reactor in turn, and then the mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 days. After that, the autoclave was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 1.5 °C⋅h-1. Blue rectangular crystals of Cu-1 (10.16 mg) were obtained (yield 65% based on H2TIA). Elem anal. Calcd for C11.5H11CuN3O5.5 (342.78): C, 40.29; H, 3.23; N, 12.26. Found: C, 40.66; H, 3.05; N, 12.32. IR (KBr pellet): 3446 (b), 3389 (b), 3127 (s), 1708 (s), 1627 (m), 1427 (m), 1364 (s), 1207 (w), 1135 (s), 1076 (m), 983 (w), 845 (w), 664 (m), 539 (s) cm-1.
